summary:
Urban development and real estate strategy professional, with:

- 25 years experience across Europe (long-term in The Netherlands, Czech Republic, Georgia and Belgium, with numerous short-term assignments in Slovakia, Romania, Bulgaria, Croatia, Lithuania, Armenia and Cyprus)
- Wide experience in both public and private sector environments and on all levels, from urban development strategies & policies to single plots and buildings
- Advanced capabilities in spatial-economic and real estate market analysis, reporting & presentation, stakeholder engagement/partnership formation and negotiation

Specialty skills: 
- Urban competitiveness and economics
- Urban development visions, strategy and policy
- Management of urban development programmes & projects, partnerships and stakeholder engagement
- Real estate development & investment strategies
- Retail, Hotels & Leisure
- Feasibility studies and concept design

Motto in Life & Work: "If you can't stand the heat, get out of the kitchen!"

awards.title: 1st Prize in the international competition "General Land Use Plan Tbilisi"
awards.description:
Member of the management team and line manager Urban Economics & Real Estate for the lead-consultant City Institute Georgia, in a large international consortium which was awarded the first prize and subsequent contract for the production of the new General Land Use Plan of Tbilisi, after a highly competitive international competition with 19 applicants.

https://propertygeorgia.ge/en/media/news/160-economic-benefits-tbilisis-general-land-use-plan

profile_positions.description: Operating vertically between strategy and project development, horizontally across disciplines and testing the ground for new approaches in integrated, sustainable and inclusive urban development in this upcoming city!
profile_positions.title: Stadsontwikkelaar (City Developer)

profile_positions.description:
Regular contributor to EUKN Policy Labs:

- Policy Lab Cyprus: "Retail policy and the functional urban area" (2017)
- Policy Lab Czech Republic: "Governance of integrated urban development" (2019)
- Policy Lab Spain: "Integrated urban development policies in the EU" (2021) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Sz5mSdXN2E&t=6361s
profile_positions.title: Member of the international expert pool

profile_positions.description:
Strategic consultancy on urban development and real estate for governments and private sector, with a focus on:
- Urban/Area Development: vision, strategy and policy
- Hotels and commercial leisure facilities 
- Governance: Management of urban development programmes & projects and partnerships

Key projects:
- Vision and programming for 200,000 sqm urban development scheme "Kronenburg" in the municipality of Amstelveen
- Feasible programme of commercial retail & leisure facilities in Amsterdam South-East
- Development strategy for hotels and commercial leisure facilities in the municipality of Ouder-Amstel
- Vision on a feasible programme for the new Pier in Scheveningen (The Hague municipality)
- Reflection on the vision for the Central Innovation District (CID), The Hague
- Advice on the update of hotel policy in the cities of Utrecht and Leiden
profile_positions.title: Principal Consultant

company.name: Martijn Kanters Urban Development & Real Estate

profile_positions.company: Martijn Kanters Urban Development & Real Estate
profile_positions.description:
Consultancy practice associated in a wide international network, including:
- JLL, Colliers, CBRE, C&W
- INTA International Urban Development Association
- City Institute Georgia
- TBSC Consulting
- Comenius Hospitality Management.

Key areas of expertise:
- Urban economics and competitiveness
- Urban development visions and strategies
- Transposing economic development strategies to spatial planning policies
- Real estate market analysis and strategy
- Management of urban development projects
- Strategic asset management
- Sector specialisation in retail and hospitality, across all levels, from public policy to project feasibility and management

Key projects:
- Tbilisi General Land Use Plan, team leader real estate market forecasting & planning (2015-2016)
- Concept, design, leasing strategy and investment plan for the first Georgian Gastronomy Centre (2014-15)
- Concept for a Wine & Jazz Bar in the city centre of Prague, incl. lease negotiation (2011)
- Real Estate Market Report Georgia (2012) project manager for Jones LangLasalle. Subsequently, in 2014, advisor to Colliers in the update
- Strategy for the development of shopping centres in Tbilisi, project manager for JLL contracted by Majid Al Futtaim Properties (UAE)
- Feasibility, business planning and concept design for various hotel developments (2012-2015)
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
Advising the Secretary General and President, focused on expanding INTA's reach in Central & Eastern Europe, member of the World Urban Development Council, member of INTA Communities of Competence on Metropolisation, Habitat, Workspace Innovation and Habitat. 

Presentations at the following INTA Congresses:
- INTA 32 Riga (2008)
- INTA 33 Taipei & Kaoshiung (2009)
- INTA 34 San Sebastian (2010)
- INTA 35 Lyon (2011)

Member of the 2009 International Urban Advisory Panel (with a.o. Joe Montgomery and Riek Bakker) that produced a new vision for Taichung Metropolitan Area (Taiwan)
profile_positions.title: Member of the Advisory Board

profile_positions.description:
Focus areas:

- Concept development (primarily innovations in retail & leisure as catalyst for urban development schemes)
- Public retail policy (e.g. implications of the EU Services Directive, preparation of regional retail policy for the province of South Holland)
- Facilitation of planning permit procedures for retail projects
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Retail & Urban Development

profile_positions.description:
Managing the Consulting & Research department at DTZ Prague with a focus on the following areas:

- providing high-quality data & analyses on real estate markets
- real estate market assessments throughout Central & Eastern Europe
- feasibility studies for real estate development projects
- strategic consultancy for large real estate owners
- strategic asset management
- Urban/Brownfield regeneration, our speciality. Established DTZ C&R as the thought leader in Czech Republic, featuring a major publication in cooperation with INTA

Key projects:
- Programming of a 1.2 m. sqm urban development scheme in Prague (Bubny district)
- Programming of a 900.000 sqm urban development scheme Tractorul Brasov (Romania)
- Repositioning strategies for various shopping centres in Czech Republic and Slovakia
- Strategic asset planning for UniCredit Bank offices in Prague
- Portfolio strategy for 6,000 ha of former mining land in the Moravia-Silesia region (Czech Republic)
profile_positions.title: Head of Consulting & Research

profile_positions.description: Management of a small portfolio of 10 real estate development projects (residential/land development, shopping centre and a business park) in Czech Republic and acquisition of new projects throughout Central & Eastern Europe.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director

profile_positions.description:
Urban development consultant, with a focus on real estate in Central & Eastern Europe and Brownfield regeneration. For 2.5 years, based in the branch office of ECORYS in the Czech Republic, Kolpron CZ and 2.5 years at department Regional & Urban Development in Rotterdam HQ. Key projects:

- Deputy Team Leader of the first Strategic Brownfield regeneration project in the Czech Republic, funded by EU Phare and managed by CzechInvest. Redevelopment plan of the 150 ha. Vitkovice Steelworks site in Ostrava.
- Real estate market assessments and feasibility studies for various projects, mostly in the Czech Republic
- Project development consultancy for EU Structural Fund projects (all urban development and tourism projects) under the last Phare funded consultancy project in the Czech Republic (2m. EUR). Provided advice to over 15 municipalities accross the country and deputy project director of the 30+ consultant team.
- An industrial zones strategy for Lithuania, funded by Phare and managed by the ministry of Economy of Lithuania. Short-term consultant on private sector involvement and PPP-solutions
- Management of large training programmes for CEE government officials for project preparation of Cohesion Fund projects
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - urban development and real estate strategy consultant
